In addition, Jeremy has a successful track record of building effective business strategies and developing a wide variety of customer relationships, strategic partnerships, investments and acquisitions in technology and Internet companies.

Prior to eBureau, Jeremy spent 3 years as VP Business Development at Vizu, a technology startup whose platform helps advertisers and publishers measure the effectiveness of their online brand advertising. As Vizuâ€™s first business executive, Jeremy led the companyâ€™s initial sales, marketing, and business development efforts and was solely responsible for closing over $1.5 million in revenue. Jeremy joined Vizu from Yahoo!, where he ran business development and revenue strategy for the Yahoo! Front Page, the Internet’s most-visited page, and My Yahoo!, the #1 personal start page on the Web. He also managed strategic technology partnerships for Yahoo! Local search and Yahoo! Maps. Prior to Yahoo!, Jeremy developed an affinity for technology startup companies as an associate with venture capital firms and as an early member of the Cisco Systems Corporate Development team, managing acquisitions and equity investments. Jeremy launched his career advising financial services and manufacturing companies on business strategy as a consultant at Braxton Associates.

Jeremy earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering sciences from Dartmouth College and an MBA as a Haas Merit Scholar from the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley.
